summary: U.S. banking regulators, including the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC), are members of the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision, which sets regulatory standards for banks to enhance financial stability. U.S. banking regulators have policies that generally direct their staff to retain documents that they create or receive during their participation on the Committee. But OCC’s policy doesn't clearly tell staff whether or...
title: Bank Capital Reforms: The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency Should Clarify Policy for Retaining Documents
